light_001.name: Brake System Warning
light_001.description: Indicates a serious issue with the braking system, such as failure or very low brake fluid.
light_001.cause: Worn brake pads, low brake fluid level, or a brake system malfunction.
light_001.solution: Stop the vehicle immediately. Check the brake fluid and call for roadside assistance or a mechanic.

light_002.name: Engine Overheating
light_002.description: The engine temperature is too high and may cause severe damage.
light_002.cause: Low coolant level, failed thermostat, radiator blockage, or water pump failure.
light_002.solution: Stop the vehicle, allow the engine to cool, check coolant level. Seek mechanical help if the issue persists.

light_003.name: Oil Pressure Low
light_003.description: Engine oil pressure has dropped below a safe level.
light_003.cause: Low oil level, oil pump failure, or blocked oil passages.
light_003.solution: Turn off the engine immediately. Check oil level and refill if needed. If the light remains, contact a mechanic.

light_004.name: Battery Charging Issue
light_004.description: The vehicle’s battery is not charging correctly.
light_004.cause: Faulty alternator, worn battery, broken drive belt, or poor electrical connections.
light_004.solution: Avoid turning off the engine. Drive to a service center or call breakdown services.

light_005.name: Airbag System Fault
light_005.description: Indicates a problem with the airbag or supplemental restraint system.
light_005.cause: Sensor fault, disconnected cable, or airbag module issue.
light_005.solution: Have the airbag system inspected by a qualified technician immediately.

light_006.name: Seatbelt Reminder
light_006.description: One or more occupants have not fastened their seatbelt.
light_006.cause: Seatbelt not buckled or sensor malfunction.
light_006.solution: Ensure all seatbelts are securely fastened.

light_007.name: Bonnet Open
light_007.description: The bonnet is not securely closed.
light_007.cause: Improper bonnet closure or faulty latch sensor.
light_007.solution: Safely pull over and close the bonnet securely.

light_008.name: Boot Open
light_008.description: The boot or tailgate is not properly closed.
light_008.cause: Boot lid not latched or faulty sensor.
light_008.solution: Stop the vehicle and properly close the boot.

light_009.name: Door Open
light_009.description: One or more doors are not securely closed.
light_009.cause: Unlatched door or defective door sensor.
light_009.solution: Stop the car and ensure all doors are closed tightly.

light_010.name: Power Steering Failure
light_010.description: Power steering system is not functioning correctly.
light_010.cause: Loss of hydraulic fluid, electrical fault, or pump failure.
light_010.solution: Avoid driving. Have the power steering system inspected immediately.

light_011.name: Transmission Fault
light_011.description: There is a fault in the automatic transmission system.
light_011.cause: Low transmission fluid, overheating, or internal damage.
light_011.solution: Drive cautiously to a garage or call for recovery. Have the transmission inspected.

light_012.name: Coolant Level Critically Low
light_012.description: Coolant level is dangerously low and can cause overheating.
light_012.cause: Coolant leak, damaged radiator, or cracked reservoir.
light_012.solution: Stop the vehicle and allow engine to cool. Refill coolant and seek inspection for leaks.

light_013.name: Parking Brake Engaged
light_013.description: Parking brake is applied or hasn’t been fully released.
light_013.cause: Manual or electronic parking brake engaged.
light_013.solution: Release the parking brake before driving.

light_014.name: SRS (Supplemental Restraint System) Fault
light_014.description: SRS system fault may prevent airbags or seatbelt tensioners from working correctly.
light_014.cause: Wiring issues, damaged sensor, or SRS module failure.
light_014.solution: Have the SRS system inspected by a technician.

light_015.name: Brake Fluid Low
light_015.description: The brake fluid level is too low.
light_015.cause: Brake fluid leak or worn brake pads causing fluid displacement.
light_015.solution: Check and top up brake fluid. Seek immediate repair if leak is suspected.

light_016.name: Engine Management (Severe Fault)
light_016.description: A critical fault has been detected in the engine control system.
light_016.cause: Engine sensor failure, misfire, or emission system issue.
light_016.solution: Do not continue driving. Call for assistance or diagnostic check immediately.

light_017.name: Electric Parking Brake Failure
light_017.description: The electronic parking brake is not working correctly.
light_017.cause: Electronic control fault, damaged switch, or wiring issue.
light_017.solution: Avoid parking on slopes. Get system checked by a mechanic immediately.

light_018.name: High Transmission Oil Temperature
light_018.description: Transmission oil is overheating, risking gearbox damage.
light_018.cause: Heavy towing, low transmission fluid, or blocked cooler.
light_018.solution: Stop and allow the transmission to cool. Check fluid levels and consult a garage.

light_019.name: AdBlue Empty (Diesel only)
light_019.description: The AdBlue tank is empty or critically low.
light_019.cause: High consumption or failure to refill.
light_019.solution: Refill AdBlue as soon as possible or the vehicle may not restart.

light_020.name: Steering Lock Malfunction
light_020.description: The steering lock may not disengage.
light_020.cause: Faulty ignition switch, software error, or sensor issue.
light_020.solution: Try restarting the car. If it persists, seek professional assistance.

light_021.name: Crash Detection / Collision Alert (Red variant)
light_021.description: Severe collision warning or crash detection alert.
light_021.cause: Proximity sensors, camera data, or actual crash detected.
light_021.solution: Check for collision damage. Call emergency services if needed.

light_022.name: EV Battery Overheating
light_022.cause: High load, thermal management system failure, or faulty battery.
light_022.solution: Stop vehicle. Allow battery to cool. Seek service inspection.

light_023.name: High Voltage System Fault (EV)
light_023.description: Critical fault in EV high-voltage electrical system.
light_023.cause: Short circuit, component failure, or controller malfunction.
light_023.solution: Do not touch electrical components. Contact EV service center immediately.

light_024.name: Check Engine Light (Minor Fault)
light_024.description: Indicates a non-urgent fault in the engine management system.
light_024.cause: Loose fuel cap, faulty sensor, or minor emissions issue.
light_024.solution: Drive with caution. Get a diagnostic check soon to avoid further issues.

light_025.name: ABS (Anti-lock Braking System) Warning
light_025.description: The anti-lock braking system is not functioning properly.
light_025.cause: Damaged wheel sensor, ABS module fault, or wiring issue.
light_025.solution: Brakes will still work but without ABS. Get system checked promptly.

light_026.name: Traction Control System (TCS) Warning
light_026.description: Indicates that the traction control system is malfunctioning or turned off.
light_026.cause: Faulty wheel speed sensor, damaged wiring, or system deactivated.
light_026.solution: Check if system was turned off manually. If not, have it diagnosed soon.

light_027.name: Electronic Stability Control (ESC) Warning
light_027.description: Warns that the electronic stability control system is not working properly.
light_027.cause: Sensor fault, software issue, or wheel slip detected.
light_027.solution: Drive cautiously and have the ESC system inspected by a professional.

light_028.name: ESC OFF Indicator
light_028.description: Indicates that the ESC system has been manually turned off.
light_028.solution: Turn ESC back on via dashboard or consult vehicle manual.

light_029.name: Tyre Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) Alert
light_029.description: One or more tyres may be under-inflated.
light_029.cause: Low tyre pressure, puncture, or faulty TPMS sensor.
light_029.solution: Check and adjust tyre pressures. Repair or replace tyres as needed.

light_030.name: Glow Plug Warning (Diesel engines)
light_030.description: Indicates preheating of diesel engine or fault in glow plug system.
light_030.cause: Glow plug failure, relay issue, or wiring fault.
light_030.solution: Wait for the light to go out before starting. If it stays on, get it checked.

light_031.name: Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) Warning
light_031.description: Warns of a partially blocked DPF filter.
light_031.cause: Short journeys preventing regeneration or excessive soot build-up.
light_031.solution: Drive at ~40mph for 15 minutes to trigger DPF regeneration. If light remains, get service.

light_032.name: Fuel Filter Water Contamination
light_032.description: Water has been detected in the diesel fuel filter.
light_032.cause: Fuel contamination or full water separator.
light_032.solution: Drain the water separator or have the filter replaced by a mechanic.

light_033.name: Low Fuel Level
light_033.solution: Refuel as soon as possible to avoid running out of fuel.

light_034.name: Low Washer Fluid
light_034.description: Washer fluid reservoir is low or empty.
light_034.cause: Normal usage or leak in washer fluid system.
light_034.solution: Top up the washer fluid reservoir with suitable solution.

light_035.name: Low Coolant Level
light_035.description: Engine coolant is below recommended level.
light_035.cause: Coolant leak, worn radiator hose, or evaporation.
light_035.solution: Allow engine to cool, then top up coolant. Check for leaks.

light_036.name: Service Reminder / Inspection Due
light_036.description: Indicates a scheduled service or inspection is due.
light_036.solution: Book a vehicle service to maintain performance and warranty.

light_037.name: Brake Pad Wear Indicator
light_037.description: Warns that the brake pads are worn and require replacement soon.
light_037.cause: Normal wear or sensor wire damage.
light_037.solution: Have brake pads checked and replaced if below recommended thickness.

light_038.name: Hill Descent Control Fault
light_038.description: System fault in hill descent control feature.
light_038.cause: Sensor issue, electrical fault, or software problem.
light_038.solution: Avoid using the feature and have it inspected by a technician.

light_039.name: Suspension System Warning
light_039.description: Indicates a problem with the vehicle's suspension system.
light_039.cause: Air or adaptive suspension failure, sensor malfunction.
light_039.solution: Drive with caution. Have the suspension system checked.

light_040.name: Air Suspension Fault
light_040.description: There is an issue with the air suspension system.
light_040.cause: Air leak, compressor failure, or control module fault.
light_040.solution: Avoid rough roads. Get system inspected by a specialist.

light_041.name: Lane Departure Warning
light_041.description: You are unintentionally drifting out of your lane.
light_041.cause: No turn signal used or distracted driving.
light_041.solution: Use indicators and stay alert. System is for assistance, not replacement of attention.

light_042.name: Lane Keep Assist Fault
light_042.description: The lane keeping assist system is not functioning.
light_042.cause: Camera obstruction, sensor fault, or software issue.
light_042.solution: Clean sensors or windscreen. Have the system checked if issue continues.

light_043.name: Blind Spot Monitoring Warning
light_043.description: Indicates a problem with the blind spot monitoring system.
light_043.cause: Dirty sensor, blocked camera, or malfunction.
light_043.solution: Clean sensor areas. Visit service center if light persists.

light_044.name: Rain/Light Sensor Fault
light_044.description: Indicates an issue with automatic light or wiper sensor.
light_044.cause: Dirty windscreen, faulty sensor, or software issue.
light_044.solution: Clean windscreen. If problem continues, seek inspection.

light_045.name: Speed Limiter Warning
light_045.description: The speed limiter system is not working correctly.
light_045.solution: Drive carefully and get the system checked by a mechanic.

light_046.name: Auto Start/Stop System Warning
light_046.description: Start/Stop system is not functioning properly.
light_046.cause: Low battery charge, engine temperature, or sensor fault.
light_046.solution: Check battery health. System will re-enable when conditions are met.

light_047.name: Adaptive Cruise Control Fault
light_047.description: Fault in the adaptive cruise control system.
light_047.cause: Sensor obstruction, radar fault, or calibration issue.
light_047.solution: Clean sensors. Get the system checked by a qualified technician.

light_048.name: Lamp Defect / Exterior Light Failure
light_048.description: One or more external lights are not working.
light_048.cause: Blown bulb, wiring issue, or socket corrosion.
light_048.solution: Replace the bulb or consult a garage if issue persists.

light_049.name: Headlight Height Adjustment Warning
light_049.solution: Have the system inspected for correct operation and visibility.

light_050.name: Fuel System Warning
light_050.description: Problem detected in the fuel supply system.
light_050.cause: Fuel pump fault, leak, or fuel pressure issue.
light_050.solution: Do not continue driving if performance is affected. Seek mechanical help.

light_051.name: Emissions Control Fault
light_051.description: There is a problem with the vehicle's emissions control system.
light_051.cause: Faulty oxygen sensor, catalytic converter, or EGR valve.
light_051.solution: Have the emissions system diagnosed and repaired to avoid MOT failure or engine issues.

light_052.name: Slippery Road Warning
light_052.description: Indicates that road conditions are slippery.
light_052.cause: Detected wheel slip or icy road conditions.
light_052.solution: Reduce speed, avoid harsh acceleration, and drive cautiously.

light_053.name: Cold Weather/Icy Road Alert
light_053.description: Ambient temperature is near or below freezing.
light_053.solution: Be cautious, particularly on untreated roads.

light_054.name: Start/Stop Unavailable
light_054.description: The engine Start/Stop system is temporarily disabled.
light_054.cause: Battery charge too low, engine too cold, or other system limits.
light_054.solution: System will reactivate automatically when conditions are met.

light_055.name: Brake Light Bulb Fault
light_055.description: One or more brake light bulbs are not functioning.
light_055.cause: Blown bulb, damaged socket, or wiring fault.
light_055.solution: Replace faulty bulbs and check connections.

light_056.name: Parking Sensor Fault
light_056.description: Problem detected with the parking sensor system.
light_056.cause: Sensor obstruction, electrical fault, or water ingress.
light_056.solution: Clean sensors. If the fault remains, have system inspected.

light_057.name: Adaptive Headlight Malfunction
light_057.description: The adaptive headlight system is not operating correctly.
light_057.cause: Sensor or motor fault, software error.
light_057.solution: Have the adaptive headlight system checked at a dealership.

light_058.name: Traffic Sign Recognition Fault
light_058.description: System cannot detect or interpret traffic signs properly.
light_058.cause: Dirty camera, bad lighting, or software issue.
light_058.solution: Clean the windscreen area in front of the camera and restart the car.

light_059.name: Rear Cross Traffic Alert
light_059.description: A vehicle is approaching from the side while reversing.
light_059.cause: Detected vehicle or obstacle using radar.
light_059.solution: Stop reversing and check surroundings carefully.

light_060.name: Night Vision System Fault
light_060.description: There is an issue with the night vision assistance system.
light_060.cause: Sensor or camera fault, software error.
light_060.solution: Have the night vision system inspected by a specialist.

light_061.name: Automatic Parking Assist Fault
light_061.cause: Camera/sensor fault, dirty sensor, or system error.
light_061.solution: Clean the sensors. Visit a service center if the warning persists.

light_062.name: Convertible Roof System Fault
light_062.cause: Hydraulic failure, latch problem, or electric motor issue.
light_062.solution: Do not operate roof. Have the system checked by a qualified technician.

light_063.name: Key Not Detected
light_063.description: The car cannot detect the electronic key.
light_063.cause: Key fob out of range, battery low, or interference.
light_063.solution: Ensure key is inside the vehicle and battery is charged.

light_064.name: Key Fob Battery Low
light_064.description: The battery in the key fob is low.
light_064.cause: Battery depletion from use or age.
light_064.solution: Replace the key fob battery as soon as possible.

light_065.name: Electric Motor Warning (Hybrid/EV)
light_065.description: An issue has been detected with the electric motor.
light_065.cause: Motor overheating, control fault, or wiring issue.
light_065.solution: Drive carefully and visit a service center for diagnosis.

light_066.name: Hybrid System Fault
light_066.description: A fault in the hybrid drive system has occurred.
light_066.cause: Battery management, inverter, or sensor issues.
light_066.solution: Seek immediate diagnostic service at a hybrid specialist.

light_067.name: Regenerative Braking System Fault
light_067.cause: Battery issue, motor fault, or system controller malfunction.
light_067.solution: Conventional brakes will still work. Get the system checked.

light_068.name: EV Charging System Fault
light_068.description: EV charging system is not working properly.
light_068.cause: Charger cable fault, battery issue, or software error.
light_068.solution: Try another charger. If fault remains, contact EV service.

light_069.name: Limited Power Mode / Tortoise Symbol
light_069.description: Vehicle is in reduced performance mode.
light_069.cause: Detected system fault, overheating, or battery protection.
light_069.solution: Drive to a service center carefully. Avoid high speed or load.

light_070.name: EV Maintenance Required
light_070.description: Indicates that scheduled EV maintenance is due.
light_070.cause: Mileage or time-based service schedule reached.
light_070.solution: Book service at an authorized EV service provider.

light_071.name: Electronic Throttle Control Fault
light_071.description: Issue detected with electronic throttle system.
light_071.cause: Throttle body malfunction, sensor issue, or wiring fault.
light_071.solution: Drive cautiously. Have system checked if light remains on.

light_072.name: Electronic Power Control (EPC)
light_072.description: Fault in engine electronics or power control system.
light_072.cause: Throttle, ignition, or fuel injection problem.
light_072.solution: Seek diagnostic help. Reduced performance likely.

light_073.name: Trailer Stability Assist Active
light_073.description: System is actively stabilizing a trailer.
light_073.cause: Detected sway or loss of trailer alignment.
light_073.solution: Slow down and check trailer connection. Avoid abrupt steering.

light_074.name: Hill Start Assist Fault
light_074.description: Fault with the hill start assist system.
light_074.cause: Brake sensor or clutch position sensor issue.
light_074.solution: Use manual braking if needed and visit a mechanic.

light_075.name: Dashcam Recording / Error
light_075.description: Dashcam is actively recording or there is a recording error.
light_075.cause: Memory full, SD card issue, or power supply problem.
light_075.solution: Check dashcam settings, memory card, and power connection.

light_076.name: Headlights On
light_076.description: Indicates that the vehicle's headlights are turned on.
light_076.cause: Manual activation or automatic system turned on due to low light.
light_076.solution: No action needed unless driving in daylight. Turn off to conserve battery.

light_077.name: High Beam Active
light_077.solution: Use responsibly to avoid dazzling oncoming drivers.

light_078.name: Front Fog Lights On
light_078.description: Front fog lights are switched on.
light_078.cause: Manual activation in poor visibility conditions.
light_078.solution: Turn off when visibility improves to avoid dazzling others.

light_079.name: Rear Fog Lights On
light_079.description: Rear fog lights are switched on.
light_079.solution: Use only in foggy or low-visibility situations.

light_080.name: Cruise Control Active
light_080.description: Indicates that cruise control is currently engaged.
light_080.cause: Cruise control system turned on and maintaining speed.
light_080.solution: Deactivate or adjust speed using the control stalk/buttons as needed.

light_081.name: Speed Limiter Active
light_081.description: Speed limiter is active, restricting top speed.
light_081.solution: Adjust or deactivate using the control stalk or menu.

light_082.name: Daytime Running Lights (DRL)
light_082.description: Daytime running lights are on for increased visibility.
light_082.cause: Automatic system active during daylight hours.
light_082.solution: No action needed. DRLs enhance vehicle visibility.

light_083.name: Automatic Headlights Active
light_083.solution: No action required unless manual override is preferred.

light_084.name: Auto Hold Active
light_084.description: Auto Hold function is engaged, holding the brake when stationary.
light_084.cause: Brake is automatically held when vehicle is stopped.
light_084.solution: Accelerate to release the hold or deactivate the system if not needed.

light_085.name: Rain Sensor Active
light_085.description: Rain sensor system is managing wiper speed.
light_085.solution: No action needed. Ensure the sensor area is clean.

light_086.name: Auto Start/Stop Active
light_086.description: Engine has stopped automatically to conserve fuel.
light_086.cause: Start/Stop conditions met during a stop (e.g., at traffic lights).
light_086.solution: System will restart engine automatically when required.

light_087.name: Windscreen Defrost Active
light_087.description: Heated windscreen is operating to remove condensation or frost.
light_087.cause: Manual or automatic activation due to detected condensation.
light_087.solution: No action needed. Turn off manually if not required.

light_088.name: Rear Window Defrost Active
light_088.description: Rear window defroster is currently active.
light_088.cause: Manual or automatic activation to clear mist or frost.
light_088.solution: Turn off when the window is clear to save battery power.

light_089.name: Indicator (Left/Right Blinkers)
light_089.description: A turn signal (indicator) is currently active.
light_089.cause: Driver activated indicator for turning or lane change.
light_089.solution: Automatically cancels or turn off manually after the maneuver.

light_090.name: Eco Mode Active
light_090.description: The vehicle is operating in fuel-saving Eco mode.
light_090.cause: Manual activation or automatic drive mode selection.
light_090.solution: No action needed unless switching to another mode.

light_091.name: Comfort/Sport Mode Selected
light_091.description: The vehicle is in Comfort or Sport drive mode.
light_091.cause: Manual selection by the driver via drive mode settings.
light_091.solution: Switch drive modes according to driving preference.

light_092.name: Adaptive Headlights Active
light_092.description: Headlights are adjusting direction based on steering and speed.
light_092.cause: System active during turns or driving at night.
light_092.solution: No action needed. Adaptive lights improve road visibility.

light_093.name: EV Ready to Drive Indicator
light_093.description: Indicates that an electric vehicle is powered on and ready to move.
light_093.cause: EV systems are active and operational.
light_093.solution: Ready to drive. No action required.

light_094.name: EV Charging in Progress
light_094.cause: Connected to a charging station or plug.
light_094.solution: No action needed. Disconnect once charging is complete.

light_095.name: Hybrid Mode Active
light_095.description: Vehicle is currently operating in hybrid drive mode.
light_095.cause: Automatic system switching between petrol and electric motors.
light_095.solution: No action needed. System will manage power source switching.

light_096.name: Regenerative Braking Active
light_096.description: Braking energy is being recovered and stored.
light_096.cause: Vehicle is decelerating using regenerative braking.
light_096.solution: No action needed. Helps recharge EV battery.

light_097.name: HUD (Head-Up Display) Active
light_097.description: The vehicle's head-up display is operational.
light_097.solution: No action needed unless display is distracting.

light_098.name: GPS Signal Indicator
light_098.description: Shows GPS signal strength or connection status.
light_098.cause: Navigation system initializing or losing signal.
light_098.solution: Ensure GPS visibility to the sky. Move vehicle if needed.

light_099.name: Radar Sensor Active
light_099.description: Radar-based system (e.g., collision or adaptive cruise) is active.
light_099.solution: No action required unless system is malfunctioning.

light_100.name: Traffic Sign Recognition Active
light_100.description: The vehicle is actively reading and displaying traffic signs.
light_100.cause: System is monitoring road signs using cameras.
light_100.solution: No action needed. Follow the displayed limits for safety.

light_101.name: Lane Assist Active
light_101.description: The lane assist system is currently active and monitoring lane position.
light_101.solution: No action needed. Always maintain control and stay aware.

light_102.name: Parking Assist Active
light_102.description: Indicates that parking assist system is currently operating.
light_102.solution: Follow system prompts and monitor surroundings.

light_103.name: Driver Attention Alert Active
light_103.description: System is monitoring driver behavior for signs of fatigue.
light_103.cause: Long drive without breaks, inconsistent steering.
light_103.solution: Consider taking a break if prompted by the system.

light_104.name: Blind Spot Monitor Active
light_104.description: Blind spot detection is active and monitoring adjacent lanes.
light_104.cause: System detecting traffic beside the vehicle.
light_104.solution: Always check mirrors manually in addition to system alerts.

light_105.name: Collision Warning System Active
light_105.description: Forward collision warning system is monitoring surroundings.
light_105.cause: Active safety system monitoring distance to vehicles ahead.
light_105.solution: Be prepared to brake if the system signals danger.

light_106.name: Speed Camera Detection Alert
light_106.description: Speed camera or zone detected by the vehicle.
light_106.solution: Adjust speed accordingly and obey road signs.

light_107.name: Smartphone Connected / Android Auto / Apple CarPlay
light_107.description: Smartphone is connected via Android Auto or Apple CarPlay.
light_107.cause: Phone connected via USB or Bluetooth.
light_107.solution: Use infotainment system safely while driving.

light_108.name: Key Detected
light_108.description: Key fob is within vehicle range.
light_108.cause: Smart key system confirms presence of key.
light_108.solution: No action needed unless warning changes.

light_109.name: Vehicle Online / OTA Updates Available
light_109.description: Vehicle is connected to a network or update is ready.
light_109.cause: Online features active or system update queued.
light_109.solution: Download and install update if prompted and safe.

light_110.name: Seat Occupancy Sensor Active
light_110.description: System detects a passenger in seat without a seatbelt.
light_110.cause: Unfastened seatbelt or child seat detected.

light_111.name: Start/Stop System Charging Battery
light_111.description: Engine is running to recharge battery before enabling start/stop.
light_111.solution: System will resume automatically once battery is charged.

light_112.name: Vehicle Restart Reminder
light_112.description: Reminder to restart the vehicle after a temporary stop.
light_112.solution: Restart the vehicle to continue driving.

light_113.name: Convertible Roof Operation
light_113.cause: Driver is opening or closing the roof.
light_113.solution: Ensure the vehicle is stationary during roof operation.

light_114.name: Roof Locking Mechanism Fault
light_114.description: Convertible roof locking system has malfunctioned.
light_114.solution: Do not drive at high speed. Visit a specialist immediately.

light_115.name: Snow Chains Required
light_115.description: Snow chains are recommended due to road conditions.
light_115.cause: Detected icy/snowy conditions via sensors or GPS.
light_115.solution: Use snow chains where legally required and drive cautiously.

light_116.name: Spare Wheel Installed Warning
light_116.description: Temporary spare wheel in use may limit vehicle functions.
light_116.solution: Drive moderately and replace with standard tyre ASAP.

light_117.name: Power Tailgate Operation Fault
light_117.description: The automatic tailgate system is not functioning correctly.
light_117.cause: Obstruction, electrical fault, or hydraulic issue.
light_117.solution: Use manual opening or contact service center.

light_118.name: Fuel Cap Open or Loose
light_118.description: Fuel cap is missing, loose, or not sealed properly.
light_118.cause: Cap not replaced correctly after refueling.
light_118.solution: Stop vehicle and secure fuel cap. Reset system if needed.

light_119.name: Bonnet Not Secured
light_119.description: The bonnet is not latched properly.
light_119.cause: Incomplete bonnet closure or latch sensor fault.
light_119.solution: Stop and close bonnet securely to avoid risk while driving.

light_120.name: Vehicle Lift Mode (Air Suspension)
light_120.description: Air suspension system is raising the vehicle.
light_120.cause: Manual lift selected or automatic adjustment.
light_120.solution: Avoid high speeds in raised mode unless off-road.

light_121.name: Tow Mode Active
light_121.description: Vehicle is in towing mode for optimal trailer handling.
light_121.cause: Manual or automatic detection of trailer.
light_121.solution: Ensure correct trailer connection and drive with care.

light_122.name: Autonomous Driving Mode Active (e.g. Tesla Autopilot)
light_122.cause: Self-driving mode or pilot assist activated.
light_122.solution: Remain attentive and ready to take control at all times.

light_123.name: System Software Update Required
light_123.description: A vehicle software update is available or required.
light_123.cause: Outdated software or manufacturer push notification.
light_123.solution: Schedule update at dealer or perform via OTA if available.

light_124.name: EV Cabin Pre-conditioning Active
light_124.description: Cabin climate control system is pre-conditioning interior.
light_124.solution: No action required. Cabin will be ready when you enter.
